cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to drift northeast across the lower Mississippi Valley and Southeast United States

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted west of Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southwest Louisiana through coastal Mississippi-Alabama into the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions 20–30 mph most likely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along Calcasieu Lake and adjacent bays
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain with accumulations of 4–6 inches, localized flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk, frequent lightning, brief squalls reducing visibility for vessel operations
